intro: Gitara venezolana, commonly known as the Venezuelan guitar plant, is a species native to the tropical regions of Venezuela. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
